intro: Acronychia normanbiensis, commonly known as the Normanby acronychia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to northern Australia, particularly Queensland, and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and distinctive fruiting structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in rainforest or coastal habitats. Its flowers are small and yellowish-green, and it produces non-toxic, edible fruits that are consumed by various wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
